fields.definition: When a person is anxious, they worry that something bad will happen.
fields.sentence: She was anxious about not making her appointment on time.

fields.definition: When something is awful, it is very bad.
fields.sentence: Her performance last night was awful.

fields.definition: To consist of is to be made of parts or things.
fields.sentence: Today’s choices for lunch consisted of pizza, hamburgers, and hot dogs.

fields.definition: To desire is to want something.
fields.sentence: My sister desires a big house and lots of money.

fields.definition: When a person is eager about something, they are excited about it.
fields.sentence: The man was eager to talk about the good news.

fields.definition: A household is all the people who live in one house.
fields.sentence: Our household is made up of my father, my mother and me.

fields.definition: An intent is a plan to do something.
fields.sentence: Her intent is to visit Italy next summer.

fields.definition: A landscape is how an area of land looks.
fields.sentence: The landscape of the country is very green.

fields.definition: To lift something is to move it higher.
fields.sentence: The man tried to lift the box.

fields.definition: To load is to put objects into something.
fields.sentence: The man loaded the boxes into a truck.

fields.definition: A lung is the organ in the body that fills with air when breathing.
fields.sentence: Having strong lungs is necessary for a healthy life.

fields.definition: A motion is a movement that someone makes.
fields.sentence: The police officer made a motion with his hand.

fields.definition: The pace of something is the speed at which it happens.
fields.sentence: I ran the race at a slower pace than my friend.

fields.definition: When someone is polite, they are acting in a thoughtful way.
fields.sentence: The boy was very polite: he behaved very thoughtfully.

fields.definition: To possess something is to have it or own it.
fields.sentence: My uncle possesses three sheep, a chicken, a cow and a dog.

fields.definition: When something happens rapidly, it happens very fast.
fields.sentence: The train moved rapidly on the tracks.

fields.definition: To remark is to say something.
fields.sentence: The teacher remarked on how quickly the students were learning.

fields.definition: To seek is to look for something.
fields.sentence: If I have a problem, I seek my sister’s advice.

fields.definition: To shine is to make a bright light.
fields.sentence: The candles are shining in the dark room.

fields.definition: To spill is to have something fall out of its container.
fields.sentence: I spilled the coffee on the table.

fields.definition: To bring means to take someone or something to a person or place.
fields.sentence: Oscar will bring in all the boxes.

fields.definition: A castle is a building with strong walls where royalty usually lives.
fields.sentence: The castle was built many years ago.

fields.definition: To command someone is to tell them to do something.
fields.sentence: The general commanded his army to attack.

fields.definition: To counsel someone is to listen and give advice about a problem.
fields.sentence: The teacher counseled the girl about her troubles.

fields.definition: To ensure is to make certain that something happens.
fields.sentence: Eating good food ensures that we stay healthy.

fields.definition: An explosion is a violent burst, usually with a loud sound.
fields.sentence: A nuclear explosion can cause great damage.

fields.definition: Jewelry is something that people wear like earrings or necklaces.
fields.sentence: The woman looked beautiful with her nice dress and jewelry.

fields.definition: To land means to come to the ground usually from a ship or aircraft.
fields.sentence: The parachutist landed safely on the ground.

fields.definition: A meteor is a rock from outer space that falls to Earth.
fields.sentence: We saw a meteor in the sky last night.

fields.definition: A monster is any imaginary frightening creature that looks strange.
fields.sentence: The monster scared everyone in the village.

fields.definition: If something is northern, it is in the direction of north.
fields.sentence: It is much colder in northern countries than it is here.

fields.definition: If something is remote, it is very far away and difficult to get to.
fields.sentence: It took many days to get to the remote island.

fields.definition: If something is southern, it is in the direction of south.
fields.sentence: Taegu is located in the southern part of the Korean peninsula.

fields.definition: A statue is an image of a person or animal made of stone or metal.
fields.sentence: I saw a beautiful statue of a lion today.

fields.definition: Steam is water that has become hot and has turned into a misty gas.
fields.sentence: We could see the steam rise from the boiling water.

fields.definition: To submit to someone is to agree to do what they tell you to do.
fields.sentence: She submitted to her mother’s wishes and did her homework.

fields.definition: A temple is a building that is used for religious purposes.
fields.sentence: The people visited the temple to pray.

fields.definition: Upper means higher in position or place.
fields.sentence: A home’s attic is at the upper part of the structure.

fields.definition: A weed is a plant, especially one that is not useful or wanted.
fields.sentence: The yard of the house was full of ugly weeds.

fields.definition: A wing is the part of an animal that lets it fly.
fields.sentence: The bird used its wings to fly across the water.

fields.definition: An arrow is a thin, straight stick shot from a bow.
fields.sentence: The arrow flew through the air and hit the target.

fields.definition: A battle is a fight between two armies during a war.
fields.sentence: The battle lasted for many days.

fields.definition: A bow is a weapon made of curved wood and string that shoots arrows.
fields.sentence: He went hunting with a bow and arrow.

fields.definition: When people are brave, they are not afraid to face pain or danger.
fields.sentence: The brave firefighter saved the girl from the burning building.

fields.definition: A chief is the leader of a group of people.
fields.sentence: The chief led the people through the mountains.

fields.definition: A disadvantage is a situation where someone is likely to lose.
fields.sentence: Mike had a disadvantage in the race since he hurt his knee.

fields.definition: An enemy is a country that is fighting another country during a war.
fields.sentence: The enemy prepared to attack the kingdom.

fields.definition: An entrance is a place where someone can enter an area.
fields.sentence: The gate was locked, so Bill had to find a different entrance.

fields.definition: If something hardly happens, it almost does not happen at all.
fields.sentence: I hardly saw the concert since I had to leave early.

fields.definition: To intend to do something means to plan to do it.
fields.sentence: I intend to finish college in three years.

fields.definition: Laughter is the sound produced by laughing about something funny.
fields.sentence: Susan’s joke made her classmates burst into laughter.

fields.definition: A log is a thick piece of wood that is cut from a tree.
fields.sentence: The fire was too small, so we added another log to it.

fields.definition: The military is the armed forces of a country.
fields.sentence: I joined the military after I finished high school.

fields.definition: To obey means to follow what a law or a person says you must do.
fields.sentence: My little sister did not obey my mother. Now she is in trouble.

fields.definition: To secure something means to get it after a lot of effort.
fields.sentence: I was able to secure a good grade on my test after weeks of studying.

fields.definition: When someone or something is steady, they are under control.
fields.sentence: The problem was hard but she remained steady and solved it.

fields.definition: To trust is to believe that someone is honest and will do what is right.
fields.sentence: I trust my friends; they don’t tell my secrets to other people.

fields.definition: To twist something is to wrap it around itself or another thing.
fields.sentence: She twisted the spaghetti around her fork.

fields.definition: Unless means if not or except when.
fields.sentence: Unless you clean your room, you cannot play with your friends.

fields.definition: A weapon is an object that can be used to hurt people.
fields.sentence: Swords have been used as weapons for thousands of years.

fields.definition: The chest is the front part of a person’s body under the neck.
fields.sentence: The water in the lake was as high as my chest.

fields.definition: If you have confidence about something, you are sure of it.
fields.sentence: I have confidence that I did well on the test.

fields.definition: A consequence is a result of a choice or action.
fields.sentence: Asa consequence of missing my bus, I had to find another way to work.

fields.definition: A disaster is a really bad thing that happens.
fields.sentence: When the car crashed, it was a disaster.

fields.definition: To disturb someone means to upset them.
fields.sentence: The loud noise disturbed me while I was working.

fields.definition: To estimate something means to make a guess about it.
fields.sentence: The boy estimated that he was one meter tall.

fields.definition: When you honor people or things, you show respect for them.
fields.sentence: I honor my science teacher by working hard in class.

fields.definition: To impress someone means to make that person proud.
fields.sentence: He was able to impress the girls with his new dance.

fields.definition: A marathon is a very long foot race just over 42 kilometers.
fields.sentence: I ran a marathon, and now my legs are tired.

fields.definition: When something is narrow, it is very thin.
fields.sentence: The bridge is too narrow for a car to drive over.

fields.definition: When something is pale, it does not have a bright color.
fields.sentence: The girl’s skin was very pale.

fields.definition: When something is rough, it is not even or smooth.
fields.sentence: The rough ground hurt my feet.

fields.definition: To satisfy someone means to make them happy.
fields.sentence: It will satisfy my teacher if I finish all my homework.

fields.definition: To scream means to make a loud noise with your mouth.
fields.sentence: The girl saw a spider and screamed.

fields.definition: When someone or something is sensitive, they are easily hurt.
fields.sentence: My teeth are sensitive to cold things.

fields.definition: The shade is a dark area that something makes when it blocks the sun.
fields.sentence: It was hot outside, so the boy sat in the shade of a tree.

fields.definition: To supplement something is to add something else to it in a good way.
fields.sentence: He supplements his diet with fresh fruits.

fields.definition: When someone feels terror, they are scared.
fields.sentence: I felt a sense of terror when the tiger chased me.

fields.definition: A threat is something bad that might happen.
fields.sentence: Due to the dark clouds, there was a threat of a bad storm.

fields.definition: A victim is a person that had something bad happen to them.
fields.sentence: I was a victim of a robbery.

fields.definition: An ancestor is a family member from the past.
fields.sentence: My ancestors came from Germany.

fields.definition: An angle is the direction from which you look at something.
fields.sentence: The giraffe turned its head to see from another angle.

fields.definition: A boot is a heavy shoe that goes over your ankle.
fields.sentence: He wore boots so that his feet wouldn’t get wet.

fields.definition: A border is the edge of an area.
fields.sentence: The postcard had a pretty green border of pine needles.

fields.definition: To congratulate someone is to tell them that you are happy for them.
fields.sentence: Bill and Angela congratulated each other on a job well done.

fields.definition: A frame is a border for a picture or mirror.
fields.sentence: I have to get a frame for my friend’s picture.

fields.definition: Heaven is the place that some people believe people go when they die.
fields.sentence: When I die, I hope that I go to heaven.

fields.definition: If someone or something is incredible, it is hard to believe they are true.
fields.sentence: I have an incredible story to tell you about my vacation.

fields.definition: A legend is a story from the past.
fields.sentence: There is a well-known legend about a king and his queen.

fields.definition: To praise is to show that you like someone or something.
fields.sentence: The coach praised both athletes after a good practice.

fields.definition: To proceed is to go in a certain direction.
fields.sentence: My son and I proceeded to the beach so we could go fishing.

fields.definition: If something is pure, it is very clear and beautiful.
fields.sentence: The rose was pure. It had no dirt or imperfections.

fields.definition: A relative is a family member.
fields.sentence: My relatives came by to see the new baby.

fields.definition: If one is senior, they are the oldest or have been there the longest.
fields.sentence: Because he got his job first, Bob is the senior chef.

fields.definition: If someone or something is silent, they make no sound.
fields.sentence: Since no one was home, the house was silent.

fields.definition: To sink into something is to slowly fall into it.
fields.sentence: The boat had a hole in it, and it sank into the ocean.

fields.definition: If someone or something is superior, they are better than another.
fields.sentence: I think cooking outdoors is superior to cooking indoors.

fields.definition: To surround something is to close in on it from all sides.
fields.sentence: We surrounded the suspect on all four sides.

fields.definition: If something is thick, it is wide and solid.
fields.sentence: The fog was so thick that I couldn’t see through it.

fields.definition: To wrap is to cover something on all sides.
fields.sentence: I wrapped his gift and put a bow on it.

fields.definition: If someone goes or travels abroad, they go to another country.
fields.sentence: My brother wants to go abroad next year.

fields.definition: To anger someone is to make them mad.
fields.sentence: It angers me when people are rude.

fields.definition: A bride is a woman who is getting married or has just gotten married.
fields.sentence: The bride looked beautiful in her wedding dress.

fields.definition: If something is brief, it only lasts fora short time.
fields.sentence: The meeting this afternoon was very brief.

fields.definition: To chase someone or something is to follow them in order to catch them.
fields.sentence: I was chased by an angry native.

fields.definition: To disappoint is to make one feel sad or unsatisfied.
fields.sentence: I do not want to disappoint my family, so I try to do well at school.

fields.definition: To dive is to jump into water.
fields.sentence: I will dive into the lake once we get there.

fields.definition: To exchange means to give something for another thing in return.
fields.sentence: I exchanged my foreign money for American dollars.

fields.definition: A favor is something you do for someone to help them.
fields.sentence: Can you do me a favor and turn off the lights?

fields.definition: A fee is an amount of money that a person or company asks for a service.
fields.sentence: I had to pay an hourly fee to speak with my lawyer.

fields.definition: If something lasts forever, it means it lasts for all time.
fields.sentence: The young couple promised that they would love each other forever.

fields.definition: A guy is an informal way to call a man.
fields.sentence: The guy at the flower shop was really helpful today.

fields.definition: If people or things are lovely, they are good-looking or beautiful.
fields.sentence: The trees look lovely in the fall.

fields.definition: A mood is the way someone is feeling.
fields.sentence: I am in a good mood because I did well on my math test.

fields.definition: A palace is a very large building. It is often the home of a royal family.
fields.sentence: The king and queen live in a beautiful palace.

fields.definition: To permit something is to let someone do it.
fields.sentence: I was sick, so my mother permitted me to stay home from school.

fields.definition: To protest something is to argue about it with someone.
fields.sentence: The people protested the decision of the president.

fields.definition: A sculpture is a piece of art that is made from wood, clay, or stone.
fields.sentence: We saw an old sculpture of Buddha at the museum.

fields.definition: A tribe is a group of people who live in the same culture.
fields.sentence: There’s a small tribe of people who live in the mountains of Spain.

fields.definition: Youth is a time in people’s lives when they are young.
fields.sentence: My mother wanted to be a nurse in her youth.

fields.definition: To do something on time’s basis is how often you do it.
fields.sentence: My grandfather gets his hearing checked on a yearly basis.

fields.definition: Biology is the study of living things.
fields.sentence: We learned about the human heart in biology class.

fields.definition: A cage is something that holds an animal so it cannot leave.
fields.sentence: We put the parrots in their cage at night.

fields.definition: A colleague is somebody you work with.
fields.sentence: My colleague helped me finish the job.

fields.definition: A colony is a country controlled by another country.
fields.sentence: The USA was at one time a colony of Great Britain.

fields.definition: To debate is to seriously discuss something with someone.
fields.sentence: The husband and wife debated over which TV to buy.

fields.definition: To depart is to leave some place so you can go to another place.
fields.sentence: The plane departed for Italy at 3:00 this afternoon.

fields.definition: To depress someone is to make them sad.
fields.sentence: The bad news from work depressed the man.

fields.definition: When something is factual, it is true.
fields.sentence: John learns about history from factual books.

fields.definition: To fascinate someone is to make them really like something.
fields.sentence: The kitten was fascinated by the ball of yarn.

fields.definition: A mission is an important job that is sometimes far away.
fields.sentence: The woman’s mission was to help sick people.

fields.definition: You use nevertheless to show that something goes against a fact.
fields.sentence: He is usually friendly. Nevertheless, he wasn’t this afternoon.

fields.definition: An occupation is a person’s job.
fields.sentence: My father’s occupation is a dentist.

fields.definition: If you go overseas, you go to a country on the other side of an ocean.
fields.sentence: John often goes overseas for vacations.

fields.definition: To persuade someone is to make them agree to do something.
fields.sentence: The children persuaded their parents to buy them gifts.

fields.definition: A route is the way you go from one place to another.
fields.sentence: I saw many new houses along the route to the city.

fields.definition: Ruins are old buildings that are not used anymore.
fields.sentence: I visited some interesting ruins in Greece.

fields.definition: A scholar is a person who studies something and knows much about it.
fields.sentence: The scholar knew much about art history.

fields.definition: When someone or something is significant, they are important.
fields.sentence: I read many significant novels as a literature major in university.

fields.definition: A volcano is a mountain with a hole on top where hot liquid comes out.
fields.sentence: When the volcano erupted, smoke and heat filled the air.

fields.definition: If something is broad, it is wide.
fields.sentence: he river is very long and broad.

fields.definition: A bush is a plant with many thin branches. It is smaller than a tree.
fields.sentence: My dad and I planted some small bushes around the house.

fields.definition: If someone or something is capable of something, they can do it.
fields.sentence: he Olympic athlete is capable of lifting a lot of weight.

fields.definition: To cheat is to be dishonest so that you can win or do well.
fields.sentence: hey cheated on the test by sharing answers.

fields.definition: To concentrate on someone or something is to give your full attention.
fields.sentence: I could not concentrate on my homework because the room was so loud.

fields.definition: To conclude is to arrive at a logical end by looking at evidence.
fields.sentence: I saw crumbs on my dog’s face, so I concluded that he ate my cookie.

fields.definition: Confident means that one believes they can do something without failing.
fields.sentence: She was confident she could climb the mountain due to her training.

fields.definition: If something is considerable, it is large in size, amount or extent.
fields.sentence: hey paid a considerable amount of money for that car.

fields.definition: To convey is to communicate or make ideas known.
fields.sentence: hat picture of a crying child conveys a feeling of sadness.

fields.definition: If something is definite, it is certain or sure to be true.
fields.sentence: here is a definite connection between hard work and success.

fields.definition: Delight is a feeling of being very happy with something.
fields.sentence: He felt such delight after getting a promotion at work.

fields.definition: A destination is the place where someone or something is going to.
fields.sentence: he destination of this plane is Munich, Germany.

fields.definition: To dictate something is to read it aloud so it can be written down.
fields.sentence: He dictated his speech so his secretary could write it down.

fields.definition: The edge of something is the part of it that is farthest from the center.
fields.sentence: He ran to the edge of the cliff.

fields.definition: A path is a way from one place to another that people can walk along.
fields.sentence: We followed a path through the woods.

fields.definition: To resort to something is to depend on it in order to solve a problem.
fields.sentence: I hope they don’t resort to violence to end the argument.

fields.definition: A shadow is the dark area that is made when something blocks light.
fields.sentence: he man’s shadow was taller than he was.

fields.definition: To succeed is to complete something that you planned or tried to do.
fields.sentence: He will continue to work on the robot until he succeeds.

fields.definition: To suspect something is to believe that it is true.
fields.sentence: I suspect that those kids stole the money.

fields.definition: A valley is a low area of land between two mountains or hills.
fields.sentence: We looked at the valley below from the top of the mountain.

fields.definition: To admire someone is to like them for what they do.
fields.sentence: I admire my brother for his hard work.

fields.definition: To aid someone is to help them when they need something.
fields.sentence: The doctor aided the boy after his accident.

fields.definition: To attempt something is to try to do that thing.
fields.sentence: I am attempting to learn English.

fields.definition: Authority is the power that someone has because of their position.
fields.sentence: The policeman has authority on the streets.

fields.definition: A capital is an important city where a country’s leaders live and work.
fields.sentence: We will visit the capital to learn about our government.

fields.definition: To cooperate is to work together to do something.
fields.sentence: The students cooperated to clean up the classroom.

fields.definition: To defend someone or something is to protect them from attack.
fields.sentence: The soldiers defended the town from the invaders.

fields.definition: Destruction is damage to something so bad that it can’t be fixed.
fields.sentence: After the big fire, there was much destruction in the city.

fields.definition: Disorder is a lack of order, or a complete mess.
fields.sentence: The teacher’s desk had many papers in disorder.

fields.definition: A division is the act of making smaller groups out of a larger one.
fields.sentence: The chart had six divisions which all had different colors.

fields.definition: To enable a person is to make it possible for them to do something.
fields.sentence: Having the key enabled us to open the door.

fields.definition: To frustrate is to prevent someone from fulfilling their desire.
fields.sentence: The machine frustrated me because I could not fix it.

fields.definition: To govern is to control the public business of a country, state, or city.
fields.sentence: The United States is governed from the White House.

fields.definition: To have plenty of something is to have more than you need.
fields.sentence: The school had plenty of books for the students to read.

fields.definition: To relieve someone is to make them feel less pain.
fields.sentence: The medicine relieved the sick boy.

fields.definition: Reputation is the opinion that people have about someone.
fields.sentence: The doctor had a reputation for helping people.

fields.definition: Royal describes something that belongs to a king or queen.
fields.sentence: The king sat upon the royal throne.

fields.definition: A slave is a person who is not free and must work for someone else.
fields.sentence: The slave worked very hard all day long.

fields.definition: To struggle is to fight against someone or something.
fields.sentence: The kids struggled with each other for the toy.

fields.definition: When someone is stupid, they lack intelligence.
fields.sentence: He said something stupid that made everyone angry at him.

fields.definition: A citizen is someone who lives in a certain town or city.
fields.sentence: Carlos was born in Spain. He is a Spanish citizen.

fields.definition: A council is a group of people who run a city or town.
fields.sentence: The council met to discuss the new laws for the city.

fields.definition: To declare is to say something officially.
fields.sentence: I declared my love for him.

fields.definition: When people or things are enormous, they are very large.
fields.sentence: My dog looks enormous next to yours.

fields.definition: When someone or something are extraordinary, they are amazing.
fields.sentence: The fireman who rescued the girl was extraordinary.

fields.definition: Fog is a thick cloud that is near the ground or water.
fields.sentence: I did not want to drive in the thick fog.

fields.definition: A funeral is a ceremony that takes place after a person dies.
fields.sentence: They had a funeral for the soldier who died during the war.

fields.definition: When people or things are giant, they are very big.
fields.sentence: The giant truck got in my way.

fields.definition: An impression is the way of thinking about someone or something.
fields.sentence: Most people’s first impression of Dr. Giani is that he is mean.

fields.definition: Income is how much money a person or business makes.
fields.sentence: Her company pays her a fairly good income.

fields.definition: When someone is mad, they are angry.
fields.sentence: Mother got mad when I didn’t listen to her.

fields.definition: If someone ought to do something, then it is the right thing to do.
fields.sentence: I ought to take my library books back.

fields.definition: To resist something is to fight against it.
fields.sentence: He resisted the treatment at the hospital.

fields.definition: To reveal is to show something.
fields.sentence: I will reveal where I hid the candy bar.

fields.definition: To rid is to make a place free from something or someone.
fields.sentence: We rid our home of mice by using traps.

fields.definition: A sword is a long sharp weapon.
fields.sentence: They used to use swords in battles in ancient times.

fields.definition: A tale is a story.
fields.sentence: She told her two friends about the wild tale of her day.

fields.definition: To trap people or animals is to capture them so they cannot get away.
fields.sentence: We trapped butterflies in a net.

fields.definition: A trial is the way a court discovers if a person is guilty or innocent.
fields.sentence: He went on trial for robbing the bank.

fields.definition: When people are violent, they want to hurt someone.
fields.sentence: The man was put into jail because he was violent.

fields.definition: Admission is the act of allowing to enter a place.
fields.sentence: The admission ticket to the movie was $5.

fields.definition: Astronomy is the study of the stars and planets.
fields.sentence: Harold loved watching the stars, so he decided to study astronomy.

fields.definition: To blame someone for something bad is to say they did it.
fields.sentence: My mom blamed me for something I didn’t do.

fields.definition: Chemistry the study of and reaction to substances.
fields.sentence: In chemistry class, the professor taught us about chemical reactions.

fields.definition: If something happens despite what you do, it happens anyway.
fields.sentence: We still played the game despite the cold weather.

fields.definition: A dinosaur is a very big animal that lived millions of years ago.
fields.sentence: I like to see the dinosaur bones at the museum.

fields.definition: An exhibit is a display of interesting things.
fields.sentence: There was an animal exhibit at the fair.

fields.definition: Fame is reputation one has gained among the public.
fields.sentence: He had fame and fortune, but he was not happy.

fields.definition: A forecast is an idea about what the weather will be like in the future.
fields.sentence: The forecast says that it will rain all week.

fields.definition: A genius is a very smart person.
fields.sentence: Since she was a genius, she easily passed all of her school exams.

fields.definition: Someone who is gentle is kind and calm.
fields.sentence: He is very gentle with the baby.

fields.definition: Geography is the study of where things are.
fields.sentence: I had to draw a map for geography class.

fields.definition: To interfere is to cause problems and keep something from happening.
fields.sentence: My little sister always interferes when I’m trying to study.

fields.definition: To do something lightly is to not push very hard.
fields.sentence: Draw lightly so you do not tear your paper.

fields.definition: A principal is a person in charge of a school.
fields.sentence: My school’s principal can be very strict with the rules.

fields.definition: A row is a line of things.
fields.sentence: James put all of his toy soldiers into neat rows.

fields.definition: A shelf is a place on a wall where you put things.
fields.sentence: I keep my clothes on a shelf in my closet.

fields.definition: If you do something out of spite, you want to be mean.
fields.sentence: He snuck into his sister’s room and stole her bag out of spite.

fields.definition: Super means really good.
fields.sentence: My dad said I did a super Job cleaning the house.

fields.definition: If something is wet, it has water on it.
fields.sentence: Since my dog was wet, he tried to shake all the water off his body.

fields.definition: To abuse someone or something means to hurt them on purpose.
fields.sentence: The mean man abused his dog when it barked too loudly.

fields.definition: To afford something means you have enough money to pay for it.
fields.sentence: I’ve been saving my money, so I can afford to buy a new bike.

fields.definition: To bake means to cook food with heat.
fields.sentence: My sister is a good cook. She bakes delicious cakes.

fields.definition: A bean is a plant seed that is good to eat.
fields.sentence: There are many different kinds of beans to eat.

fields.definition: A candle is a stick of wax that is lit on fire for light or heat.
fields.sentence: When the lights went out, we lit some candles.

fields.definition: To convert something means to change it into something else.
fields.sentence: The man converted his messy field into a garden of flowers.

fields.definition: A debt is an amount of money that a person owes.
fields.sentence: I have not paid my gas bill. I owe a debt to the gas company.

fields.definition: To decrease something is to make it less than it was before.
fields.sentence: Hiring more police officers has decreased crime in the city.

fields.definition: A fault is a mistake.
fields.sentence: It is my fault that the cat ran away. I left the door open.

fields.definition: A fund is an amount of money that people have.
fields.sentence: We all put money into our club’s fund.

fields.definition: When someone is generous, they like to give things to people.
fields.sentence: The generous man donated several new computers to our school.

fields.definition: An ingredient is something that is part of a food dish.
fields.sentence: The main ingredients in cake are eggs, sugar and flour.

fields.definition: To insist means to be firm in telling people what to do.
fields.sentence: I insist that you try some of these cookies.

fields.definition: A mess is a condition that is not clean or neat.
fields.sentence: Heather’s room was a complete mess.

fields.definition: Metal is a strong material people use to build things.
fields.sentence: Steel is a common metal that is used to build buildings.

fields.definition: To monitor people or things is to watch them closely.
fields.sentence: The teacher monitors the students when they take tests.

fields.definition: To oppose something means to dislike it or act against it.
fields.sentence: I want to be a police officer because I oppose crime.

fields.definition: If a person is passive, they do not take action to solve problems.
fields.sentence: Marcie is so passive that she never solves her own problems.

fields.definition: A quantity is a certain amount of something.
fields.sentence: I have a small quantity of milk in my glass.

fields.definition: To sue someone is to take them to court for something wrong they did.
fields.sentence: I sued the company after I slipped on a banana peel in their hallway.

fields.definition: When someone has anxiety, they have a lot of worries and fear.
fields.sentence: When I have to climb to high places, I’m filled with anxiety.

fields.definition: An army is a large group of people who fight in wars.
fields.sentence: The army protects all the people in the country.

fields.definition: A billion is a very large number: 1,000,000,000.
fields.sentence: There are billions of stars in outer space.

fields.definition: To carve means to cut into something.
fields.sentence: My father usually carves the turkey for Thanksgiving.

fields.definition: To consult someone means to ask them for help.
fields.sentence: I will consult my accountant to find a way to pay for my bills.

fields.definition: An emergency is a time when someone needs help right away.
fields.sentence: There is a huge fire in my house! This is an emergency!

fields.definition: When someone has good fortune, it means they have luck.
fields.sentence: I have good fortune when I play cards.

fields.definition: To guarantee means to know something will happen.
fields.sentence: I guarantee that the sun will come up in the morning.

fields.definition: To hike means to walk in the mountains or forest.
fields.sentence: I always bring plenty of equipment with me when I hike.

fields.definition: When something is initial, it is the first thing.
fields.sentence: The initial step when writing a paper is to find a good topic.

fields.definition: If something is intense, it is very strong.
fields.sentence: The skunk made an intense odor that filled the air.

fields.definition: To lend something is to give it to someone for a short time.
fields.sentence: My sister lost her pen, so I will lend her mine.

fields.definition: The peak is the very top of a mountain.
fields.sentence: There is snow on the peaks of those mountains.

fields.definition: Potential means capable of being but not yet in existence.
fields.sentence: I’ve thought of some potential problems with your idea.

fields.definition: When you have pride, you are happy with yourself.
fields.sentence: I take pride in getting good grades.

fields.definition: Proof is a fact that shows something is real.
fields.sentence: They used his fingerprint as proof for the crime he committed.

fields.definition: To quit something means to stop doing it.
fields.sentence: I quit running because I got tired.

fields.definition: To spin is to turn around in circles.
fields.sentence: The boy kept spinning until he fell down.

fields.definition: When people or things are tiny, they are very small.
fields.sentence: A baby’s hand is tiny.

fields.definition: A tutor is someone who gives lessons in a certain subject.
fields.sentence: My sister is bad at math. So my mother hired a tutor to help her.

fields.definition: If something is apparent, it is easy to see.
fields.sentence: Her happiness was apparent from the smile on her face.

fields.definition: When people are blind, they cannot see.
fields.sentence: The blind man didn’t see the hole and almost fell in.

fields.definition: To calculate is to find an answer using math.
fields.sentence: I calculated how much money I would need to buy the car.

fields.definition: To chat is to talk with someone.
fields.sentence: Even though they were far apart, the couple chatted every day.

fields.definition: To commit to something is to promise to do it.
fields.sentence: Seth wanted to go home, but he had committed to finishing the job.

fields.definition: To compose something is to make it from smaller parts.
fields.sentence: Tonya composed her report using many sources of information.

fields.definition: A dormitory is a school building where students live.
fields.sentence: I will move into the dormitory at the beginning of the school year.

fields.definition: To exhaust someone is to make them tired.
fields.sentence: John exhausted himself by swimming all day.

fields.definition: A greenhouse is a small glass building that is used to grow plants.
fields.sentence: We have a small greenhouse in our backyard where we grow plants.

fields.definition: To ignore something is to act like you do not see or hear it.
fields.sentence: I ignored the message he was making and kept studying.

fields.definition: If something is obvious, it is clear and easily seen.
fields.sentence: It was obvious that he was tired. He kept falling asleep.

fields.definition: Physics is a science that deals with energy and how it affects things.
fields.sentence: In physics class, we used Newton’s Cradle to learn about energy.

fields.definition: A portion of something is a part of it.
fields.sentence: I only ate a small portion of the pizza.

fields.definition: To remind someone is to tell them to remember to do something.
fields.sentence: Nick’s dad reminded him to do his homework.

fields.definition: A secretary is a person who works in an office.
fields.sentence: Rebecca asked her secretary to type a report.

fields.definition: If something is severe, it is very bad or serious.
fields.sentence: After hitting his hand with the hammer, Sam was in severe pain.

fields.definition: If someone has a talent, they are naturally able to do it well.
fields.sentence: Maria has a talent for playing the piano.

fields.definition: A thesis is an idea that needs to be proved.
fields.sentence: She did not support her thesis very well.

fields.definition: A uniform is a piece of clothing worn by people of the same group.
fields.sentence: All the members of our marching band wear matching uniforms.

fields.definition: Vision is the act of seeing.
fields.sentence: The eye doctor tested my vision.

fields.definition: To absorb a liquid means to take it inside.
fields.sentence: He used a sponge to absorb the water on the floor.

fields.definition: A boss is a person in charge of other people at work.
fields.sentence: My boss is a nice person.

fields.definition: A committee is a group of people who meet together to make decisions.
fields.sentence: The school’s committee agreed on a new dress code for students.

fields.definition: A contract is a written agreement between two people.
fields.sentence: The woman signed a contract when she bought the house.

fields.definition: A crew is a group of workers.
fields.sentence: My father has a crew. They help him build houses.

fields.definition: To devote time to something means to spend a lot of time doing it.
fields.sentence: She devotes two hours a day to playing the piano.

fields.definition: To dig is to make a hole in the ground.
fields.sentence: My dog digs in the yard so he can hide his bones.

fields.definition: To dine means to eat dinner.
fields.sentence: The young couple dined at their home.

fields.definition: To donate is to give something to a charity or organization.
fields.sentence: We donate money to Christmas charities every year.

fields.definition: If something is double, it is twice as much, or twice as many.
fields.sentence: I paid almost double the amount for that shirt.

fields.definition: To elevate something is to put it at a higher level.
fields.sentence: The man elevated the picture so he could see it better.

fields.definition: A flavor is the taste of food or drinks.
fields.sentence: The flavor of the ice cream was very good.

fields.definition: A foundation is a group that provides money for research.
fields.sentence: The foundation raised money to give scholarships to students.

fields.definition: A generation is a group of people who live at the same time.
fields.sentence: My grandparents are from a different generation than me.

fields.definition: A handle is the part of an object people hold while using it.
fields.sentence: The pot is very hot. So pick it up by the handle.

fields.definition: A layer covers over something or is between two things.
fields.sentence: There was a layer of snow on the tops of the houses this morning.

fields.definition: Mud is soft, wet dirt.
fields.sentence: My brother played rugby in the mud. Now he’s dirty.

fields.definition: If something is smooth, it has no bumps.
fields.sentence: The baby’s skin felt very smooth.

fields.definition: Soil is the top layer of land on the Earth.
fields.sentence: The boy planted flowers in the soil and watered them every day.

fields.definition: If people or things are unique, they are not like the others.
fields.sentence: Her dog is unique. I’ve never seen one quite like it.

fields.definition: A chamber is an old word for a bedroom.
fields.sentence: The girl was tired. She went to her chamber fora nap.

fields.definition: To deny something is to say it is not true.
fields.sentence: The boy denied that he broke the window.

fields.definition: A document is an official piece of writing.
fields.sentence: He was given an official document proving he was a citizen.

fields.definition: To emphasize is to give importance or attention to something.
fields.sentence: She emphasized the key points by circling them in red ink.

fields.definition: A fever is a high body temperature that people get when they are sick.
fields.sentence: Lydia had a high fever so she didn’t go to school.

fields.definition: The flu is a type of sickness that makes you feel weak or your body hurt.
fields.sentence: Since he had the flu, he felt miserable.

fields.definition: To freeze is to become very cold.
fields.sentence: If you don’t wear your coat in winter, you will freeze.

fields.definition: A gesture is a movement of the hands or body.
fields.sentence: My teacher makes a lot of gestures when she speaks.

fields.definition: To interrupt is to briefly stop someone when they are doing something.
fields.sentence: My mother interrupted me when I was trying to listen to music.

fields.definition: To last is to continue or go on for an amount of time.
fields.sentence: The football match lasted for nearly two hours.

fields.definition: Likeness means the state of being like, or resemblance.
fields.sentence: Michelle bears a strong likeness to her older sister Kate.

fields.definition: Moreover means besides or in addition to something.
fields.sentence: It’s cold outside. Moreover, the wind is very strong.

fields.definition: A perspective is the way you think about something.
fields.sentence: The man’s speech gave me a new perspective on our country.

fields.definition: When something is rational, it is normal or practical.
fields.sentence: It is hard to think in a rational way when you are scared.

fields.definition: To recover is to go back to normal after something bad happens.
fields.sentence: I hope the city will recover soon after the flood.

fields.definition: To rely on something or someone is to trust or depend on them.
fields.sentence: The boy relied on his older brother to help him.

fields.definition: To shock people is to surprise them.
fields.sentence: The man was shocked by the news.

fields.definition: When people are shy, they are nervous around people strange to them.
fields.sentence: The girl was too shy to try out for the play.

fields.definition: To stare at something is to look at it for a long time.
fields.sentence: The young couple stared into each other’s eyes.

fields.definition: Thus means as a result or for that reason.
fields.sentence: The sun was shining. Thus, I wore my sunglasses.

fields.definition: An aim is a goal someone wants to make happen.
fields.sentence: My aim is to become a helicopter pilot.

fields.definition: To attach is to put two things together.
fields.sentence: I attached the socks to the clothesline to dry.

fields.definition: To bet is to risk money on the result of a game or a business.
fields.sentence: How much will you bet that your horse will win?

fields.definition: A carriage is a vehicle pulled by a horse.
fields.sentence: We took a carriage ride in the park.

fields.definition: If something is classic, it is typical.
fields.sentence: The athlete made a classic mistake-he started running too soon.

fields.definition: To commute is to travel a long distance to get to work.
fields.sentence: I usually commute to work on the train.

fields.definition: To confirm is to make sure something is correct.
fields.sentence: Winning the game confirmed that James was a good player.

fields.definition: To criticize is to say you do not like someone or something.
fields.sentence: He criticized his wife forspending too much money.

fields.definition: To differ is to not be the same as another person or thing.
fields.sentence: I differ from my brother: he is short, while I am tall.

fields.definition: An expense is the money that people spend on something.
fields.sentence: She wrote down all the expenses for her trip.

fields.definition: If something is formal, it is done in an official way.
fields.sentence: It was a formal dinner, so we wore our best clothes.

fields.definition: Height is how tall someone or something is.
fields.sentence: My height is 168 centimeters.

fields.definition: To invent something is to create something that never existed before.
fields.sentence: My grandfather has invented some interesting things.

fields.definition: If someone is junior in their job, they do not have a lot of power.
fields.sentence: When she started at the company, she was only a junior manager.

fields.definition: Labor is the act of doing or making something.
fields.sentence: Building the house took a lot of labor.

fields.definition: A mechanic is someone who fixes vehicles or machines.
fields.sentence: We took the car to the mechanic to be fixed.

fields.definition: If something is prime, it is the most important one.
fields.sentence: Dirty air is a prime cause of illness.

fields.definition: To shift to something is to move into a new place or direction.
fields.sentence: He shifted to the other side of the table to eat his breakfast.

fields.definition: A signal is a sound or action that tells someone to do something.
fields.sentence: The coach blew his whistle as a signal to begin the game.

fields.definition: When people are sincere, they tell the truth.
fields.sentence: He sounded sincere when he apologized to me.

fields.definition: Ability is the quality of a person being able to do something well.
fields.sentence: His swimming abilities let him cross the entire lake.

fields.definition: Agriculture is the growing of food and animals.
fields.sentence: The farmer studied agriculture in college.

fields.definition: A cartoon is a funny drawing.
fields.sentence: Sometimes, people draw cartoons for the newspaper.

fields.definition: The ceiling is the top of a room.
fields.sentence: He painted the ceiling with a special roller.

fields.definition: To convince someone means to make them sure of something.
fields.sentence: She convinced me to buy the house.

fields.definition: When you are curious about something, you want to know more about it.
fields.sentence: I opened up the clock because I was curious about how it worked.

fields.definition: To delay means to wait to do something.
fields.sentence: I was delayed at the airport for over two hours.

fields.definition: A diary is a book in which people write their personal experiences.
fields.sentence: I do not let anybody read my diary.

fields.definition: An element of something is a particular part of it.
fields.sentence: Tackling an opponent is Johnny’s favorite element of American footbal.

fields.definition: When people have faith in something, they believe in it and trust it.
fields.sentence: The sick girl had faith in doctors. She knew they would make her better.

fields.definition: Grain is food crops such as wheat, corn, rice or oats.
fields.sentence: The farmer planted two fields of grain this year.

fields.definition: To greet someone means to meet and welcome them.
fields.sentence: When my friend came over, I greeted him at the door.

fields.definition: To investigate means to search for something or learn about it.
fields.sentence: The detective went to investigate the crime.

fields.definition: Joy is a feeling you get when you are really happy.
fields.sentence: I love baseball. I feel joy when I play.

fields.definition: A label is a tag that tells about something.
fields.sentence: The label on the back of your shirt will tell you what size it is.

fields.definition: A monk is a religious person who lives a simple life.
fields.sentence: The monks knew a lot about religion.

fields.definition: When something is odd, it is unusual.
fields.sentence: Her cat is odd. It walks on two feet.

fields.definition: To pause means to stop doing something for a while.
fields.sentence: Since she was so hungry, she paused to make a snack.

fields.definition: A priest is a person trained to perform religious duties.
fields.sentence: The priest taught us about God.

fields.definition: A profession is a person’s job.
fields.sentence: He loved sailing, so he chose to work on ships as a profession.

fields.definition: To adopt someone is to make them as a part of one’s own family.
fields.sentence: The girl was adopted by the couple when she was three.

fields.definition: To beg is to ask for something one really wants.
fields.sentence: The man begged for some money.

fields.definition: If A is beyond B, A is farther away.
fields.sentence: John’s house is beyond that lake.

fields.definition: A costume is a set of clothes people wear for a particular occasion.
fields.sentence: The woman wore a mask with her costume.

fields.definition: To exclaim is to say something loudly, usually due to being excited.
fields.sentence: “Look at her dress!” Sara exclaimed.

fields.definition: To extend is to stretch out or reach.
fields.sentence: The boy extended his hand to catch the ball.

fields.definition: A fool is someone who makes unwise choices.
fields.sentence: The girl was a fool for playing too close to the water.

fields.definition: To forbid is to tell someone they cannot do something.
fields.sentence: My father forbids watching TV while we’re eating dinner.

fields.definition: To illustrate is to show something by drawing a picture.
fields.sentence: The executive illustrated the decreasing profits of the company.

fields.definition: Indeed means truly or really.
fields.sentence: The birthday party was indeed fun last night.

fields.definition: To interpret is to explain what something means.
fields.sentence: The woman interpreted what her co-worker was trying to say.

fields.definition: If people do something kindly, they do it in a nice way.
fields.sentence: The stranger kindly cared for the hurt man.

fields.definition: A motive is the reason someone does something.
fields.sentence: His motive for studying so hard is to get into a good college.

fields.definition: A nest is a place where a bird lays its eggs.
fields.sentence: The bird laid her eggs in the nest that she made.

fields.definition: The origin of someone or something is where they come from.
fields.sentence: The origin of the honey that we eat is from a beehive.

fields.definition: A reception is a party to welcome a person or celebrate an event.
fields.sentence: We all danced and had a good time at the wedding reception.

fields.definition: To reject is to refuse something because you do not want it.
fields.sentence: The girl rejected the broken cup.

fields.definition: Silence is complete quiet.
fields.sentence: The man asked for silence while he worked on the problem.

fields.definition: A stream is a small river.
fields.sentence: The boy caught a fish in the stream.

fields.definition: Tone is the sound of someone’s voice. It shows how they feel.
fields.sentence: My father’s tone told me I had broken the rule.

fields.definition: To accomplish something means to finish it.
fields.sentence: He accomplished his goal of running ten miles.

fields.definition: To approve of something means you like it or are happy about it.
fields.sentence: Her co-workers approved her new plan.

fields.definition: Approximate means to be close to an exact amount, number or time.
fields.sentence: My approximate height is two meters.

fields.definition: A barrier is something that is in your way.
fields.sentence: The Great Wall was a barrier between China and its enemies.

fields.definition: To detect something means to notice or find something.
fields.sentence: The boy ran to the kitchen when he detected the smell of cookies.

fields.definition: A duty is something that a person has to do.
fields.sentence: It is parents’ duty to take care of their children.

fields.definition: When something is elementary, it is the first or most simple thing.
fields.sentence: Children go to elementary school before high school.

fields.definition: A failure happens when you do not do something right.
fields.sentence: My cooking ended in failure because I burned the food.

fields.definition: When something is gradual, it happens slowly.
fields.sentence: Children learn to read at a gradual pace. They do not learn right away.

fields.definition: An immigrant is a person who moves to a different country.
fields.sentence: My parents were immigrants. They came from Poland.

fields.definition: To insert something means to put it in something else.
fields.sentence: The mailman inserted the letter into the mailbox.

fields.definition: An instant is a very short amount of time.
fields.sentence: A microwave oven cooks food in an instant.

fields.definition: Poverty is the state of being poor.
fields.sentence: Poverty is a problem in many countries around the world.

fields.definition: To pretend means to make believe something is real.
fields.sentence: The boy liked to pretend he was a king.

fields.definition: A person’s rank is their place in an order of people.
fields.sentence: The man got to the rank of captain in the navy.

fields.definition: Recognition is getting praise from other people.
fields.sentence: The hero got recognition for his brave deed.

fields.definition: To refrigerate something means to make it cold.
fields.sentence: Grocery stores refrigerate fruit to make it last long.

fields.definition: Rent is the money people pay to someone to live in a certain place.
fields.sentence: To live in this house, I have to pay rent at the start of each month.

fields.definition: To retire is to leave a job, usually because of old age.
fields.sentence: My father is sixty-five years old. He is about to retire from work.

fields.definition: A statistic is a number that tells a fact about something.
fields.sentence: The statistics showed that we did just as well this year as last year.

fields.definition: An astronaut is a person that goes into outer space.
fields.sentence: The astronaut was walking on the moon.

fields.definition: When you are awake, you are not asleep.
fields.sentence: Sometimes I lay awake in bed because I am not tired.

fields.definition: When you have courage, you are not afraid.
fields.sentence: The man had the courage to touch the lion.

fields.definition: To float is to move on top of water without sinking.
fields.sentence: The boy’s toy boat floated in the pool.

fields.definition: To grant something is to allow someone to have it.
fields.sentence: The teacher granted us a break after studying hard all day.

fields.definition: Gravity is the force that makes things fall to Earth.
fields.sentence: There is no gravity in space.

fields.definition: A jewel is a beautiful stone that is worth a lot of money.
fields.sentence: A diamond is one of the most expensive jewels in the world.

fields.definition: A miner is a person who works in a mine.
fields.sentence: The miner was looking for gold.

fields.definition: A mineral is a type of substance found in the Earth.
fields.sentence: Rocks are made up of different kinds of minerals.

fields.definition: To participate is to take part in something.
fields.sentence: The students participated in the school play.

fields.definition: Permission means the act of allowing the doing of something.
fields.sentence: I have permission to drive my mom’s car.

fields.definition: To pour a liquid means to make it come out of a container.
fields.sentence: I poured some milk into my sister’s cup.

fields.definition: Someone or something’s presence is the fact they are there.
fields.sentence: The presence of dark clouds meant it would rain.

fields.definition: If a material is raw, it is natural and has not been processed.
fields.sentence: The company dumped raw sewage into the river.

fields.definition: A satellite is something that is sent into space to get information.
fields.sentence: The satellite was traveling around the earth.

fields.definition: The scale of something is its size, especially when it is very large.
fields.sentence: I was surprised by the scale of the buildings in the downtown area.

fields.definition: To skip something is to not do it.
fields.sentence: He skipped work to get more sleep.

fields.definition: To stretch is to make your arms or legs reach out.
fields.sentence: She stretched her body before exercising.

fields.definition: A telescope is a tool people use to look at the stars.
fields.sentence: With a telescope, you can see the moon and stars easily.

fields.definition: When something is underground, it is below the surface of the Earth.
fields.sentence: Subway trains travel underground.

fields.definition: An alarm is something that warns people of danger.
fields.sentence: When the students heard the fire alarm, they left the building.

fields.definition: When people or things are apart, they are not close together.
fields.sentence: The couple decided to live apart from each other.

fields.definition: To arrest someone means to catch them for doing something bad.
fields.sentence: The man was arrested for breaking the law.

fields.definition: An award is a prize someone gets for doing something well.
fields.sentence: He got an award for having the best grades in class.

fields.definition: A breed is a group of animals within a species.
fields.sentence: I like small dog breeds, such as terriers.

fields.definition: A bucket is a round containerto put things in.
fields.sentence: I filled the bucket with water.

fields.definition: A contest is a game or a race.
fields.sentence: The girls had a contest to see who could jump higher.

fields.definition: To convict someone means to prove that they did a bad thing.
fields.sentence: He was convicted of the crime and sent to jail.

fields.definition: A garage is the part of a house where people put their cars.
fields.sentence: My car does not get dirty because I keep it in the garage.

fields.definition: A journalist is a person who writes news stories.
fields.sentence: The journalist took notes for a story he was writing.

fields.definition: A pup is a young dog.
fields.sentence: All the girl wanted for her birthday was a pup.

fields.definition: To qualify is to get, or to be declared, adequate or good enough.
fields.sentence: He qualified to go to the final match by beating the opponent.

fields.definition: To repair something is to fix it.
fields.sentence: I repaired the flat tire on my car.

fields.definition: To resume something means to start it again after taking a break.
fields.sentence: I put the newspaper down to eat breakfast. Then I resumed reading.

fields.definition: To rob a person or place is to take their property by using force.
fields.sentence: A thief has robbed me of my passport.

fields.definition: To slip means to slide and fall down.
fields.sentence: The man slipped on the wet floor.

fields.definition: Somewhat means to some degree, but not to a large degree.
fields.sentence: James was somewhat upset when he had to move some boxes.

fields.definition: When something is stable, it will not fall over.
fields.sentence: The chair is stable. Its legs are strong.

fields.definition: A tissue is a soft piece of paper people use to wipe their noses.
fields.sentence: There was a box of tissue on the table.

fields.definition: A yard is the ground just outside of a person’s house.
fields.sentence: The girls jumped rope in the yard.

fields.definition: If two things or people are alike, they are similar in some way.
fields.sentence: People often think my sister and I look alike.

fields.definition: To annoy someone means to bother them.
fields.sentence: The flies buzzing around John’s head annoyed him very much.

fields.definition: Architecture is the style or way a building is made.
fields.sentence: The architecture of the church is amazing.

fields.definition: If something is artificial, it is made to look like something natural.
fields.sentence: That soccer field has artificial grass, but it looks real.

fields.definition: A chain is a series of connected loops often used to keep things in place.
fields.sentence: The scary dog was secured with a chain.

fields.definition: If something is distinct, it is easily noticed or different from other things.
fields.sentence: That girl has distinct pink hair.

fields.definition: To distinguish is to recognize differences between things.
fields.sentence: The twins look exactly the same. It is hard to distinguish between them.

fields.definition: Dust is very tiny pieces of dirt or other matter.
fields.sentence: In the old house, the dust was thick on the floor and chairs.

fields.definition: Excitement means to feel a lot of happiness about something.
fields.sentence: Did you see the excitement in her when the team scored?

fields.definition: To heal means to make a part of the body healthy again after injury.
fields.sentence: After my broken arm heals, I can play baseball again.

fields.definition: To inherit is to get something from someone who has died.
fields.sentence: She inherited her mother’s gold earrings.

fields.definition: A manner is the way someone does something.
fields.sentence: His manner of not looking at someone while speaking, is a bit rude.

fields.definition: Something mounts when it becomes stronger over time.
fields.sentence: His fear mounted as the monster crawled out from under his bed.

fields.definition: A roof is the outside top part of a building.
fields.sentence: The roof was covered with snow.

fields.definition: A shortage is a lack of something you need or want.
fields.sentence: Since there was a shortage of food, people were hungry.

fields.definition: If something is solid, it is made of firm material.
fields.sentence: The safe looked to be quite solid.

fields.definition: A stock is a stored amount of something.
fields.sentence: They keep a stock of rice so they’ll always have something to eat.

fields.definition: A substance is any specific material or mixture of materials.
fields.sentence: Water is an important substance for all living things.

fields.definition: A tomb is a grave where a dead person is buried.
fields.sentence: Their whole family is buried inside the tomb.

fields.definition: A wound is an injury to the body.
fields.sentence: He had many wounds after the car accident.

fields.definition: A bath is water in a tub. People take a bath to get clean.
fields.sentence: After playing in the dirt, the boy took a bath.

fields.definition: To bend is to move something so it is not straight.
fields.sentence: Lee bent over and picked up the paper on the ground.

fields.definition: To chew is to move your mouth to break up food.
fields.sentence: I always chew my food carefully before swallowing it.

fields.definition: When a person is disabled, they cannot do what a normal person can do.
fields.sentence: The disabled man used a wheelchair to move around.

fields.definition: If something is fantastic, it is really good.
fields.sentence: The student did a fantastic job on his project and got an award.

fields.definition: Fiction is a story that is not true.
fields.sentence: I enjoy reading works of fiction because they are very entertaining.

fields.definition: A flag is a piece of colored cloth that represents something.
fields.sentence: Our country has a beautiful flag.

fields.definition: To inspect is to look at something carefully.
fields.sentence: The mechanic inspected our car to see if it had any problems.

fields.definition: A journal is a type of magazine that deals with an academic subject.
fields.sentence: Mi-young was busy working on an article for an art journal.

fields.definition: A liquid is a substance that is neither solid nor gas.
fields.sentence: Water is the most important liquid for life.

fields.definition: To marvel at something is to feel surprise and interest in it.
fields.sentence: We marveled at her excellent piano playing.

fields.definition: A nutrient is something that a living thing needs to keep it alive.
fields.sentence: Vegetables are full of important nutrients.

fields.definition: To overcome a problem is to successfully fix it.
fields.sentence: She overcame her shyness and spoke in front of the class.

fields.definition: To recall something is to remember it.
fields.sentence: She was trying to recall what she had told her friend.

fields.definition: To regret something is to wish that it didn’t happen.
fields.sentence: I regret that I was mean to my sister.

fields.definition: A soul is a person’s spirit.
fields.sentence: Some people believe that the soul lives after the body dies.

fields.definition: When something is sufficient, you have enough of it.
fields.sentence: After eating a sufficient amount of food, I left the table.

fields.definition: Surgery is medical treatment when the doctor cuts open your body.
fields.sentence: I needed surgery to repair my leg after the accident.

fields.definition: If something is tough, it is difficult.
fields.sentence: The man passed his driving test even though it was very tough.

fields.definition: A tube is a pipe through which water or air passes.
fields.sentence: The pile of tubes was going to be put in the ground.

fields.definition: To admit something means to say that it is true.
fields.sentence: I had to admit that I stole his idea.

fields.definition: A bin is a container that holds things.
fields.sentence: He put his trash in the bin.

fields.definition: A bowl is a deep, round dish that holds food or liquid.
fields.sentence: I ate a bowl of cereal for breakfast.

fields.definition: A cabin is a small house made of wood.
fields.sentence: My grandfather owns a small cabin in the country.

fields.definition: Cash is money in the form of paper or coins.
fields.sentence: I was able to save up enough cash to buy my mother a gift.

fields.definition: A criminal is a person who does something against the law.
fields.sentence: The police made sure the criminal couldn’t move his hands.

fields.definition: A dozen is a group of twelve things.
fields.sentence: Mom brought home a dozen donuts for us as a treat.

fields.definition: An elder is a person who is older than the people around them.
fields.sentence: Uncle Ray is my elder so I always try to be respectful.

fields.definition: If something is facial, it is related to a person’s face.
fields.sentence: I could tell from his facial features that he was angry.

fields.definition: A fence is a structure around a house or field.
fields.sentence: The farmer put up a fence so that no one could walk on her field.

fields.definition: To inspire means to make a person want to do something.
fields.sentence: I was inspired to write a poem after watching the sunrise.

fields.definition: When something is mere, it is small or not important.
fields.sentence: We lost the game by a mere two points.

fields.definition: If something is neat, it is very clean or organized well.
fields.sentence: My sister always keeps her bedroom very neat.

fields.definition: An occasion is a time when something important happens.
fields.sentence: Her graduation was an occasion to have a good time.

fields.definition: A penalty is a punishment, given when someone breaks a rule or law.
fields.sentence: I had to pay a $100 penalty for parking in the wrong spot.

fields.definition: When someone is rude, they are mean and not polite.
fields.sentence: The children at the bus stop were very rude.

fields.definition: To settle a problem means to end it by finding a solution.
fields.sentence: It took three of our best executives all day to settle the problem.

fields.definition: A vehicle is a thing that moves people or things to another place.
fields.sentence: A ferry is a vehicle that takes people from one island to another.

fields.definition: A wallet is a thing that holds money and fits in a pocket.
fields.sentence: I keep my money in a wallet.

fields.definition: To yell is to say something very loudly.
fields.sentence: The coach yelled at his team for their poor performance.

fields.definition: To accuse someone of something is to blame them for doing it.
fields.sentence: She accused her brother of breaking her computer.

fields.definition: To adjust something means to change it so it is better.
fields.sentence: He adjusted the old guitar to make it sound better.

fields.definition: To amuse someone means to do something that is funny or entertaining.
fields.sentence: The singer was very good. She amused the crowd.

fields.definition: Coral is the hard, colorful material formed by the shells of animals.
fields.sentence: The diver admired the beautiful coral under the water.

fields.definition: Cotton is a cloth made from the fibers of the cotton plant.
fields.sentence: I like to wear clothes made from cotton in the summer.

fields.definition: To crash means to hit and break something.
fields.sentence: There was a loud noise when the car crashed into the tree.

fields.definition: A deck is a wooden floor built outside of a house or the floor of a ship.
fields.sentence: A ship will store many supplies below its deck.

fields.definition: To engage in something means to do it.
fields.sentence: Dad was engaged in sawing a piece of wood in half.

fields.definition: When something is firm, it is solid but not too hard.
fields.sentence: He sleeps better on a firm bed.

fields.definition: Fuel is something that creates heat or energy.
fields.sentence: Heat is the fuel that comes from fire.

fields.definition: When something is grand, it is big and liked by people.
fields.sentence: The grand mountain rose high into the sky.

fields.definition: A hurricane is a bad storm that happens over the ocean.
fields.sentence: The wind from the hurricane bent the palm tree.

fields.definition: A loss means the act or an instance of losing something.
fields.sentence: I suffered a big loss while I was gambling.

fields.definition: If something is simple, it is plain and not decorated.
fields.sentence: He bought a pair of plain white shoes over the weekend.

fields.definition: A reef is a group of rocks or coral that rise to or near the ocean.
fields.sentence: He walked along the reef and looked at the water below.

fields.definition: To shut something means to close it tightly.
fields.sentence: Please shut the door; the air outside is cold.

fields.definition: When someone is strict, they make sure others follow rules.
fields.sentence: The teacher is strict. She does not let students talk in class.

fields.definition: To surf means to use a special board to ride on waves in the ocean.
fields.sentence: The students went to the beach to surf during their vacation.

fields.definition: A task is a piece of work to be done that is usually difficult.
fields.sentence: My task for the weekend was to clean the entire back yard.

fields.definition: A zone is an area that has different qualities from the ones around it.
fields.sentence: Firefighters often work in danger zones.

fields.definition: An apology is something someone says to show that they are sorry.
fields.sentence: After arguing with her teacher, the girl wrote the teacher an apology.

fields.definition: If someone is bold, they are not afraid of doing something.
fields.sentence: The bold man climbed the high mountain.

fields.definition: To capture someone or something is to catch them.
fields.sentence: James tried to capture the bubbles in his hands.

fields.definition: If a rule or quality is cardinal, then it is the most important one.
fields.sentence: Raising your hand in the classroom before you speak is a cardinal rule.

fields.definition: A duke is a man of high social rank but below a king or queen.
fields.sentence: The duke ruled over the land.

fields.definition: To expose is to make known something that is hidden.
fields.sentence: He took off his shirt exposing his costume.

fields.definition: If people feel guilty, they feel bad for what they did.
fields.sentence: I felt guilty for taking my sister’s cookies.

fields.definition: To hire someone is to pay them money to work for you.
fields.sentence: We hired a man to paint our house.

fields.definition: If someone is innocent, they are not guilty of a crime.
fields.sentence: The judge said that the woman was innocent of the crime.

fields.definition: Jail is a place where criminals go to be punished.
fields.sentence: The thief was caught and sent to jail for ten years.

fields.definition: A minister is an important person in government with many duties.
fields.sentence: The minister of education controls the country’s schools.

fields.definition: If someone or something is ordinary, they are not special in any way.
fields.sentence: Today was just an ordinary day. Nothing unusual happened.

fields.definition: If something is permanent, it lasts for a long time or forever.
fields.sentence: We don’t know if Aunt Mildred’s visit will be a permanent one.

fields.definition: To preserve is to protect something from harm.
fields.sentence: Dad sprayed a chemical on the house to help preserve its looks.

fields.definition: To pronounce is to say the sounds of letters or words.
fields.sentence: Young children often have trouble pronouncing words right.

fields.definition: To resemble someone is to look like them.
fields.sentence: The baby resembles his father a great deal.

fields.definition: A symptom of a bad condition or illness is a sign that it is happening.
fields.sentence: Sneezing and a high fever are symptoms of the common cold.

fields.definition: Tobacco is a plant whose leaves are smoked, such as in cigarettes.
fields.sentence: The tobacco in cigarettes is bad for your health.

fields.definition: Twins are two children born at the same time.
fields.sentence: My sister and I are twins. We look exactly the same.

fields.definition: A witch is a woman with magical powers.
fields.sentence: People think that witches fly around on broomsticks.

fields.definition: To accompany other people means to join them or go with them.
fields.sentence: My brothers accompanied me to the movie.

fields.definition: When something is bare, it is plain. It has no covering.
fields.sentence: He likes to walk around in his bare feet.

fields.definition: A branch is the part of a tree with leaves.
fields.sentence: The monkey was hanging from a branch on the tree.

fields.definition: A breath is the air that goes into and out of one’s lungs.
fields.sentence: You can’t take a breath under water.

fields.definition: A bridge is something that is built over a river so people can cross it.
fields.sentence: The old bridge fell into the river.

fields.definition: To cast something means to throw it.
fields.sentence: The fisherman cast his line into the water.

fields.definition: To dare means to be brave enough to try something.
fields.sentence: He dared to jump out of the airplane and skydive.

fields.definition: When something is electronic, it uses electricity to do something.
fields.sentence: I like having electronic devices such as an MP3 player.

fields.definition: An inn is a place where travelers can rest and eat.
fields.sentence: The visitor got a room at the inn.

fields.definition: A net is a bag made of strong thread. It is used to catch animals.
fields.sentence: The boy caught butterflies in his net.

fields.definition: A philosophy is a way to think about truth and life.
fields.sentence: My philosophy is “live and let live. ”

fields.definition: A pot is a deep, round metal container used for cooking.
fields.sentence: Don’t touch the pot on the stove. It’s hot.

fields.definition: A seed is the hard part of a plant or fruit that trees grow from.
fields.sentence: I planted the seed in the dirt hoping that it would grow into a tree.

fields.definition: When something is sharp, it has a thin edge that cuts things easily.
fields.sentence: That knife is very sharp. Be careful not to hurt yourself.

fields.definition: A sort of something is a type of it.
fields.sentence: What sort of instrument do you want to learn to play?

fields.definition: To subtract means to take something away.
fields.sentence: We learned how to subtract numbers from each other in class.

fields.definition: When something is tight, it is fixed or fastened firmly in place.
fields.sentence: The knots were too tight to untie.

fields.definition: If something is virtual, then it is very close to being true or accurate.
fields.sentence: Because he’s popular, Joe is the virtual leader of the group.

fields.definition: To weigh something means to see how heavy it is.
fields.sentence: The little dog weighed exactly 3kgs.

fields.definition: To whisper means to say very quietly.
fields.sentence: We have to whisper in the library so people can focus on reading.

fields.definition: If ideas are abstract, they are based on general ways of thinking.
fields.sentence: The idea of beauty is abstract and changes over time.

fields.definition: If something is annual, it happens once a year.
fields.sentence: The only time I see my aunts and uncles is at our annual family picnic.

fields.definition: Clay is a type of heavy, wet soil used to make pots.
fields.sentence: She made a bowl out of the clay.

fields.definition: Cloth is material used to make clothes.
fields.sentence: His shirt is made of a very soft type of cloth.
