fields.definition: A curtain is a cloth hung over a window or used to divide a room.
fields.sentence: She opened the curtains to let light into the room.

fields.definition: To deserve is to be worthy of something as a result of one’s actions.
fields.sentence: The dog deserved a bone for behaving very well.

fields.definition: Feathers are the things covering birds’ bodies.
fields.sentence: That bird has orange feathers on its chest.

fields.definition: If land is fertile, it is able to produce good crops and plants.
fields.sentence: The farmer grew many vegetables in the fertile soil.

fields.definition: A flood is an event in which water covers an area which is usually dry.
fields.sentence: After three days of rain, there was a flood in the city.

fields.definition: Furniture is the things used in a house such as tables and chairs.
fields.sentence: His living room only had a few simple pieces of furniture.

fields.definition: A grave is the place where a dead person is buried.
fields.sentence: We visit our grandfather’s grave each year.

fields.definition: If something is ideal, it is the best that it can possibly be.
fields.sentence: This house is an ideal place for my family. It has everything we need.

fields.definition: Intelligence is the ability to learn and understand things.
fields.sentence: Because of his high intelligence, he finished school early.

fields.definition: If something happens nowadays, it happens at the present time.
fields.sentence: In the past people walked everywhere. Nowadays, they use cars.

fields.definition: To obtain is to get something you want or need.
fields.sentence: After I passed the test, I obtained my driver’s license.

fields.definition: When something is religious, it has to do with religion.
fields.sentence: The holy man spoke about religious topics.

fields.definition: When something is romantic, it has to do with love.
fields.sentence: The young couple went to see a romantic movie.

fields.definition: A shell is a hard covering that protects the body of some sea creatures.
fields.sentence: There were many pretty shells on the beach.

fields.definition: A shore is the edge of a large body of water.
fields.sentence: All of the boats were floating near the shore.

fields.definition: A wheel is a round thing on a vehicle that turns when it moves.
fields.sentence: A car has four wheels.

fields.definition: To appeal to someone is to be interesting or attractive to them.
fields.sentence: Sleeping all day appeals to me, but I have to go to school.

fields.definition: To assume something is to think that it is true, even with no proof.
fields.sentence: I assume you are both familiar with this plan.

fields.definition: To borrow something is to take it and then give it back later.
fields.sentence: Can I borrow a pencil to use today? I’ll give it back to you tomorrow.

fields.definition: A client is a person or business that pays another to do a service.
fields.sentence: She has many clients who enjoy coming to her salon.

fields.definition: The downtown is the center of most cities.
fields.sentence: The downtown is filled with many tall buildings.

fields.definition: If something is dull, it is not exciting.
fields.sentence: The movie was very dull. I fell asleep watching it.

fields.definition: To embarrass someone is to make them feel ashamed or foolish.
fields.sentence: He was embarrassed when he couldn’t remember her name.

fields.definition: A fare is an amount of money paid to use a bus, train, or taxi.
fields.sentence: Since he is a senior, my grandfather pays a low fare for the bus.

fields.definition: Former describes something that used to be but is not any more.
fields.sentence: The hotel, a former castle, was built over 200 years ago.

fields.definition: A formula is a set mathematical way or method of solving a problem.
fields.sentence: I learned a new formula that may help us with our problem.

fields.definition: To found a company or organization means to start it.
fields.sentence: The pilgrims founded one of the first colonies in the United States.

fields.definition: To invest means to use money in a way that will bring a profit later.
fields.sentence: I invested money in a new building that should bring me a profit.

fields.definition: A loan is the act of lending something, usually money.
fields.sentence: I got a loan from the bank.

fields.definition: If something is practical, it is useful in normal life.
fields.sentence: Learning English is practical; you can use it in many places.

fields.definition: A quarter is 25 cents.
fields.sentence: He paid a quarter for the candy.

fields.definition: A salary is how much money a person makes at his or her job.
fields.sentence: He got a new job with a better salary.

fields.definition: A scholarship is money given to one so they can go to school.
fields.sentence: I got a scholarship to help me pay for university.

fields.definition: If something is temporary, it exists for a short time.
fields.sentence: This car is only temporary; I’ll get a new one soon.

fields.definition: A treasure is a collection of valuable things, especially jewels or gold.
fields.sentence: They became very rich when they found the buried treasure.

fields.definition: To urge someone is to try very hard to get them to do something.
fields.sentence: He urged them to believe his story.
